info.title: TzKT API
info.description:
# Introduction

TzKT Explorer provides free REST API and WebSocket API for accessing detailed Tezos blockchain data and helps developers build more services and applications on top of Tezos.
TzKT is an open-source project, so you can easily clone and build it and use it as a self-hosted service to avoid any risks of depending on third-party services.

TzKT API is available for the following Tezos networks with the following base URLs:

- Mainnet: `https://api.tzkt.io/` or `https://api.mainnet.tzkt.io/` ([view docs](https://api.tzkt.io)) 
- Hangzhounet: `https://api.hangzhounet.tzkt.io/` ([view docs](https://api.hangzhounet.tzkt.io))
- Ithacanet: `https://api.ithacanet.tzkt.io/` ([view docs](https://api.ithacanet.tzkt.io))

We also provide a staging environment for testing newest features and pre-updating client applications before deploying to production:

- Mainnet staging: `https://staging.api.tzkt.io/` or `https://staging.api.mainnet.tzkt.io/` ([view docs](https://staging.api.tzkt.io))

Feel free to contact us if you have any questions or feature requests.
Your feedback really helps us make TzKT better!

- Discord: https://discord.gg/aG8XKuwsQd
- Telegram: https://t.me/baking_bad_chat
- Slack: https://tezos-dev.slack.com/archives/CV5NX7F2L
- Twitter: https://twitter.com/TezosBakingBad
- Email: hello@baking-bad.org

And don't forget to star TzKT project [on GitHub](https://github.com/baking-bad/tzkt) ;)

# Terms of Use

TzKT API is free for everyone and for both commercial and non-commercial usage.

If your application or service uses the TzKT API in any forms: directly on frontend or indirectly on backend,
you must mention that fact on your website or application by placing the label
**"Powered by TzKT API"** or **"Built with TzKT API"** with a direct link to [tzkt.io](https://tzkt.io).


# Rate Limits

There will be no rate limits as long as our servers can handle the load without additional infrastructure costs.
However, any apparent abuse will be prevented by setting targeted rate limits.

Check out [Tezos Explorer API Best Practices](https://baking-bad.org/blog/tag/TzKT/)
and in particular [how to optimize requests count](https://baking-bad.org/blog/2020/07/29/tezos-explorer-api-tzkt-how-often-to-make-requests/).

---

get.description:
Returns a list of operations related to the specified account.
Note: for better flexibility this endpoint accumulates query parameters (filters) of each `/operations/{type}` endpoint,
so a particular filter may affect several operation types containing this filter.
For example, if you specify an `initiator` it will affect all transactions, delegations and originations,
because all these types have an `initiator` field.

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Account address (starting with tz or KT)

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Comma separated list of operation types to return (`endorsement`, `preendorsement`, `ballot`, `proposal`, `activation`, `double_baking`, `double_endorsing`, `double_preendorsing`, `nonce_revelation`, `delegation`, `origination`, `transaction`, `reveal`, `register_constant`, `set_deposits_limit`, `migration`, `revelation_penalty`, `baking`, `endorsing_reward`). If not specified then the default set will be returned.

parameters.name: initiator
parameters.description: Filters transactions, delegations and originations by initiator. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: sender
parameters.description: Filters transactions, delegations, originations, reveals and seed nonce revelations by sender. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: target
parameters.description: Filters transactions by target. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: prevDelegate
parameters.description: Filters delegations by prev delegate. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: newDelegate
parameters.description: Filters delegations by new delegate. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: contractManager
parameters.description: Filters origination operations by manager. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: contractDelegate
parameters.description: Filters origination operations by delegate. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: originatedContract
parameters.description: Filters origination operations by originated contract. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: accuser
parameters.description: Filters double baking and double endorsing by accuser. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: offender
parameters.description: Filters double baking and double endorsing by offender. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: baker
parameters.description: Filters seed nonce revelation operations by baker. Allowed fields for `.eqx` mode: none.

parameters.name: level
parameters.description: Filters operations by level.

parameters.name: timestamp
parameters.description: Filters operations by timestamp.

parameters.name: entrypoint
parameters.description: Filters transactions by entrypoint called on the target contract.

parameters.name: parameter
parameters.description:
Filters transactions by parameter value. Note, this query parameter supports the following format: `?parameter{.path?}{.mode?}=...`,
            so you can specify a path to a particular field to filter by, for example: `?parameter.token_id=...` or `?parameter.sigs.0.ne=...`.

parameters.name: hasInternals
parameters.description: Filters transactions by presence of internal operations.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filters transactions, delegations, originations and reveals by operation status (`applied`, `failed`, `backtracked`, `skipped`).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort mode (0 - ascending, 1 - descending), operations of different types can only be sorted by ID.

parameters.name: lastId
parameters.description: Id of the last operation received, which is used as an offset for pagination

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of items to return

parameters.name: micheline
parameters.description: Format of the parameters, storage and diffs: `0` - JSON, `1` - JSON string, `2` - raw micheline, `3` - raw micheline string

parameters.name: quote
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of ticker symbols to inject historical prices into response

parameters.name: from
parameters.description: Start of the datetime range to filter by (ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-11-31)

parameters.name: to
parameters.description: End of the datetime range to filter by (ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-12-31)

parameters.name: currency
parameters.description: Currency to convert amounts to (`btc`, `eur`, `usd`, `cny`, `jpy`, `krw`, `eth`, `gbp`)

parameters.description: `true` if you want to use historical prices, `false` to use current price

parameters.name: delimiter
parameters.description: Column delimiter (`comma`, `semicolon`)

parameters.name: separator
parameters.description: Decimal separator (`comma`, `point`)

Example: `anyof.baker.sender=tz1...` will return operations where `baker` OR `sender` is equal to the specified value. This parameter is useful when you need to retrieve all operations associated with a specified account.

address.description: Public key hash of the account

alias.description: Name of the project behind the account or account description

publicKey.description: Base58 representation of account's public key, revealed by the account

revealed.description: Public key revelation status. Unrevealed account can't send manager operation (transaction, origination etc.)

counter.description: An account nonce which is used to prevent operation replay

delegate.description: Information about the current delegate of the account. `null` if it's not delegated

delegationLevel.description: Block height of latest delegation. `null` if it's not delegated

delegationTime.description: Block datetime of latest delegation (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`). `null` if it's not delegated

numContracts.description: Number of contracts, created (originated) and/or managed by the contract

activeTokensCount.description: Number of account tokens with non-zero balances

tokenBalancesCount.description: Number of tokens the account ever had

tokenTransfersCount.description: Number of token transfers from/to the account

numActivations.description:
Number of account activation operations. Are used to activate accounts that were recommended allocations of
tezos tokens for donations to the Tezos Foundation’s fundraiser

numDelegations.description: Number of delegation operations, related to the account

numOriginations.description: Number of all origination (deployment / contract creation) operations, related to the account

numTransactions.description: Number of all transaction (tez transfer) operations, related to the account

numReveals.description: Number of reveal (is used to reveal the public key associated with an account) operations of the contract

numRegisterConstants.description: Number of register global constant operations sent by the account

numSetDepositsLimits.description: Number of set deposits limit operations sent by the account

numMigrations.description:
Number of migration (result of the context (database) migration during a protocol update) operations,
related to the account (synthetic type)

firstActivity.description: Block height of the first operation, related to the account

firstActivityTime.description: Block datetime of the first operation, related to the account (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

lastActivity.description: Height of the block in which the account state was changed last time

lastActivityTime.description: Datetime of the block in which the account state was changed last time (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

metadata.description: Metadata of the account (alias, logo, website, contacts, etc)

address.description: Public key hash of the delegate (baker)

type.description: Type of the account, `delegate` - account, registered as a delegate (baker)

address.description: Public key hash of the delegate (baker)

revealed.description: Public key revelation status. Unrevealed account can't send manager operation (transaction, origination etc.)

balance.description: Total balance of the delegate (baker), including spendable and frozen funds (micro tez)

frozenDeposit.description: Amount of security deposit, currently locked for baked (produced) blocks and (or) given endorsements (micro tez)

frozenDepositLimit.description: Configured max amount allowed to be locked as a security deposit (micro tez)

counter.description: An account nonce which is used to prevent operation replay

activationLevel.description: Block height when delegate (baker) was registered as a baker last time

activationTime.description: Block datetime when delegate (baker) was registered as a baker last time (ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-11-31)

deactivationLevel.description: Block height when delegate (baker) was deactivated as a baker because of lack of funds or inactivity

deactivationTime.description: Block datetime when delegate (baker) was deactivated as a baker because of lack of funds or inactivity (ISO 8601, e.g. 2019-11-31)

stakingBalance.description: Baker's own balance plus delegated balance (micro tez)

delegatedBalance.description: Total amount delegated to the baker (micro tez)

numContracts.description: Number of contracts, created (originated) and/or managed by the delegate (baker)

activeTokensCount.description: Number of account tokens with non-zero balances

tokenBalancesCount.description: Number of tokens the account ever had

tokenTransfersCount.description: Number of token transfers from/to the account

numDelegators.description: Number of current delegators (accounts, delegated their funds) of the delegate (baker)

numBlocks.description: Number of baked (validated) blocks all the time by the delegate (baker)

numEndorsements.description: Number of given endorsements (approvals) by the delegate (baker)

numPreendorsements.description: Number of given preendorsements (approvals) by the delegate (baker)

numBallots.description: Number of submitted by the delegate ballots during a voting period

numProposals.description: Number of submitted (upvoted) by the delegate proposals during a proposal period

numActivations.description:
Number of account activation operations. Are used to activate accounts that were recommended allocations of
tezos tokens for donations to the Tezos Foundation’s fundraiser

numDoubleBaking.description:
Number of double baking (baking two different blocks at the same height) evidence operations,
included in blocks, baked (validated) by the delegate

numDoubleEndorsing.description:
Number of double endorsement (endorsing two different blocks at the same block height) evidence operations,
included in blocks, baked (validated) by the delegate

numDoublePreendorsing.description:
Number of double preendorsement (preendorsing two different blocks at the same block height) evidence operations,
included in blocks, baked (validated) by the delegate

numNonceRevelations.description: Number of seed nonce revelation (are used by the blockchain to create randomness) operations provided by the delegate

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify an account type to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type=delegate`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify an account type to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type.ne=contract`.

**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify a contract kind to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?kind=smart_contract`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a contract kind to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?kind.ne=delegator_contract`.

in.description:

Specify a comma-separated list of contract kinds to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values.

Example: `?kind.in=smart_contract,asset`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of contract kinds to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?kind.ni=smart_contract,asset`.

eq.description:

Specify a `tz` or `KT` address to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?sender=tz1WnfXMPaNTBmH7DBPwqCWs9cPDJdkGBTZ8`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a `tz` or `KT` address to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?sender.ne=tz1WnfXMPaNTBmH7DBPwqCWs9cPDJdkGBTZ8`.

ni.description:

Specify a comma-separated list of addresses to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?sender.ni=tz1WnfXMPaNTB,tz1SiPXX4MYGNJND`.

eqx.description:
**Equal to another field** filter mode. \
Specify a field name to get items where the specified fields are equal.

Example: `?sender.eqx=target`.

nex.description:
**Not equal to another field** filter mode. \
Specify a field name to get items where the specified fields are not equal.

Example: `?sender.nex=initiator`.

null.description:
**Is null** filter mode. \
Use this mode to get items where the specified field is null or not.

Example: `?initiator.null` or `?initiator.null=false`.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance=1234`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance.ne=1234`.

gt.description:
**Greater than** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is greater than the specified value.

Example: `?balance.gt=1234`.

ge.description:

Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is greater than equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance.ge=1234`.

lt.description:
**Less than** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is less than the specified value.

Example: `?balance.lt=1234`.

le.description:

Example: `?balance.le=1234`.

in.description:

Example: `?level.in=12,14,52,69`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of integers to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?level.ni=12,14,52,69`.

eq.description:

Example: `?active=true` or `?active=1` or `?active`.

null.description:

fields.description:
**Fields** selection mode (optional, i.e. `select.fields=balance` is the same as `select=balance`). \
Specify a comma-separated list of fields to include into response.

Example: `?select=address,balance` => `[ { "address": "asd", "balance": 10 } ]`.

values.description:
**Values** selection mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of fields to include their values into response.

Example: `?select.values=address,balance` => `[ [ "asd", 10 ] ]`.

asc.description:
**Ascending** sort mode (optional, i.e. `sort.asc=id` is the same as `sort=id`). \
Specify a field name to sort by.

Example: `?sort=balance`.

desc.description:
**Descending** sort mode. \
Specify a field name to sort by descending.

Example: `?sort.desc=id`.

el.description:
**Elements** offset mode (optional, i.e. `offset.el=123` is the same as `offset=123`). \
Skips specified number of elements.

Example: `?offset=100`.

pg.description:
**Page** offset mode. \
Skips `page * limit` elements. This is a classic pagination.

Example: `?offset.pg=1`.

cr.description:
**Cursor** offset mode. \
Skips all elements with the `cursor` before (including) the specified value. Cursor is a field used for sorting, e.g. `id`.
Avoid using this offset mode with non-unique or non-sequential cursors such as `amount`, `balance`, etc.

Example: `?offset.cr=45837`.

Type of the operation, `endorsement` - is operation, which specifies the head of the chain as seen by the endorser of a given slot.
The endorser is randomly selected to be included in the block that extends the head of the chain as specified in this operation.
A block with more endorsements improves the weight of the chain and increases the likelihood of that chain being the canonical one.

kind.description:
Kind of the voting period
`proposal` - delegates can submit protocol amendment proposals using the proposal operation
`exploration` -  bakers (delegates) may vote on the top-ranked proposal from the previous Proposal Period using the ballot operation
`testing` - If the proposal is approved in the Exploration Period, the testing (or 'cooldown') period begins and bakers start testing the new protocol
`promotion` - delegates can cast one vote to promote or not the tested proposal using the ballot operation
`adoption` - after the proposal is actually accepted, the ecosystem has some time to prepare to the upgrade
Learn more: https://tezos.gitlab.io/whitedoc/voting.html

kind.description:
Kind of the contract (`delegator_contract` or `smart_contract`),
where `delegator_contract` - manager.tz smart contract for delegation purpose only

alias.description: Name of the project behind the contract or contract description

address.description: Public key hash of the contract

typeHash.description:
32-bit hash of the contract parameter and storage types.
This field can be used for searching similar contracts (which have the same interface).

codeHash.description:
32-bit hash of the contract code.
This field can be used for searching same contracts (which have the same script).

type.description: Type of the operation, `transaction` - is a standard operation used to transfer tezos tokens to an account

id.description: Unique ID of the operation, stored in the TzKT indexer database

level.description: The height of the block from the genesis block, in which the operation was included

timestamp.description: Datetime of the block, in which the operation was included (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

block.description: Hash of the block, in which the operation was included

counter.description: An account nonce which is used to prevent operation replay

initiator.description: Information about the initiator of the transaction call

sender.description: Information about the account sent the transaction

nonce.description: An account nonce which is used to prevent internal operation replay

gasLimit.description: A cap on the amount of gas a given operation can consume

gasUsed.description: Amount of gas, consumed by the operation

storageLimit.description: A cap on the amount of storage a given operation can consume

storageUsed.description: Amount of storage, consumed by the operation

bakerFee.description: Fee to the baker, produced block, in which the operation was included (micro tez)

storageFee.description: The amount of funds burned from the sender account for used the blockchain storage (micro tez)

allocationFee.description: The amount of funds burned from the sender account for account creation (micro tez)

target.description: Information about the target of the transaction

parameter.description: Transaction parameter, including called entrypoint and value passed to the entrypoint.

storage.description: Contract storage after executing the transaction converted to human-readable JSON. Note: you can configure storage format by setting `micheline` query parameter.

diffs.description: List of bigmap updates (aka big_map_diffs) caused by the transaction.

status.description:
Operation status (`applied` - an operation applied by the node and successfully added to the blockchain,
`failed` - an operation which failed with some particular error (not enough balance, gas limit, etc),
`backtracked` - an operation which was successful but reverted due to one of the following operations in the same operation group was failed,
`skipped` - all operations after the failed one in an operation group)

errors.description: List of errors provided by the node, injected the operation to the blockchain. `null` if there is no errors

hasInternals.description:
An indication of whether the transaction has an internal operations
`true` - there are internal operations
`false` - no internal operations

quote.description: Injected historical quote at the time of operation

entrypoint.description: Entrypoint called on the target contract

value.description: Value passed to the called entrypoint converted to human-readable JSON. Note: you can configure parameters format by setting `micheline` query parameter.

block.description: Hash of the block, in which the operation was included

gasUsed.description: Amount of gas, consumed by the operation

block.description: Hash of the block, in which the operation was included

kind.description:
Kind of the migration 
`bootstrap` - balance updates, included in the first block after genesis
`activate_delegate` - registering a new baker (delegator) during protocol migration
`airdrop` - airdrop of 1 micro tez during Babylon protocol upgrade
`proposal_invoice` - invoice for creation a proposal for protocol upgrade
`code_change` - changing contract scripts during Babylon protocol upgrade
`origination` - implicit (hardcoded in the protocol) origination of liquidity baking contracts
`subsidy` - liquidity baking subsidy

account.description: Information about the account whose balance has updated as a result of the operation

balanceChange.description: The amount for which the operation updated the balance (micro tez)

storage.description: Contract storage after the migration converted to human-readable JSON. Note: you can configure storage format by setting `micheline` query parameter.

diffs.description: List of bigmap updates caused by the migration.

block.description: Hash of the block, in which the operation was included

baker.description: Information about the delegate (baker) who has lost rewards due to unrevealed seed nonces

missedLevel.description: Height of the block, which contains hash of the seed nonce, which was to be revealed

loss.description: Reward for baking and gathered fees from the block, which were lost due to unrevealed seed nonces (micro tez)

bonus.description: Bonus reward paid to the block producer (micro tez)

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=2020-01-01` is the same as `param=2020-01-01`). \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp.ne=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

gt.description:
**Greater than** filter mode. \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is greater than the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp.gt=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

ge.description:
**Greater or equal** filter mode. \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is greater than equal to the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp.ge=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

lt.description:
**Less than** filter mode. \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is less than the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp.lt=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

le.description:
**Less or equal** filter mode. \
Specify a datetime to get items where the specified field is less than or equal to the specified value.

Example: `?timestamp.le=2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of datetimes to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values.

Example: `?timestamp.in=2020-02-20,2020-02-21`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of datetimes to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?timestamp.ni=2020-02-20,2020-02-21`.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?parameters=abc`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?parameters.ne=abc`.

as.description:
**Same as** filter mode. \
Specify a string template to get items where the specified field matches the specified template. \
This mode supports wildcard `*`. Use `\*` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?parameters.as=*mid*` or `?parameters.as=*end`.

un.description:
**Unlike** filter mode. \
Specify a string template to get items where the specified field doesn't match the specified template.
This mode supports wildcard `*`. Use `\*` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?parameters.un=*mid*` or `?parameters.un=*end`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of strings to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values. \
Use `\,` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?errors.in=bla,bal,abl`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of strings to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values. \
Use `\,` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?errors.ni=bla,bal,abl`.

null.description:
**Is null** filter mode. \
Use this mode to get items where the specified field is null or not.

Example: `?parameters.null` or `?parameters.null=false`.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify a JSON value to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?parameter.from=tz1...` or `?parameter.signatures.[3].[0]=null` or `?parameter.sigs.[*]=null`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a JSON value to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?parameter.ne=true` or `?parameter.amount.ne=0`.

gt.description:
**Greater than** filter mode. \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is greater than the specified value.
Note that all stored JSON values are strings, so this will be a comparison of two strings, so we recommend comparing values of the same type,
e.g. numeric strings with numeric strings (`parameter.number.gt=123`), datetime strings with datetime strings (`parameter.date.gt=2021-01-01`), etc.
Otherwise, result may surprise you.

Example: `?parameter.balance.gt=1234` or `?parameter.time.gt=2021-02-01`.

ge.description:
**Greater or equal** filter mode. \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is greater than equal to the specified value.
Note that all stored JSON values are strings, so this will be a comparison of two strings, so we recommend comparing values of the same type,
e.g. numeric strings with numeric strings (`parameter.number.gt=123`), datetime strings with datetime strings (`parameter.date.gt=2021-01-01`), etc.
Otherwise, result may surprise you.

Example: `?parameter.balance.ge=1234` or `?parameter.time.ge=2021-02-01`.

lt.description:
**Less than** filter mode. \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is less than the specified value.
Note that all stored JSON values are strings, so this will be a comparison of two strings, so we recommend comparing values of the same type,
e.g. numeric strings with numeric strings (`parameter.number.gt=123`), datetime strings with datetime strings (`parameter.date.gt=2021-01-01`), etc.
Otherwise, result may surprise you.

Example: `?parameter.balance.lt=1234` or `?parameter.time.lt=2021-02-01`.

le.description:
**Less or equal** filter mode. \
Specify a string to get items where the specified field is less than or equal to the specified value.
Note that all stored JSON values are strings, so this will be a comparison of two strings, so we recommend comparing values of the same type,
e.g. numeric strings with numeric strings (`parameter.number.gt=123`), datetime strings with datetime strings (`parameter.date.gt=2021-01-01`), etc.
Otherwise, result may surprise you.

Example: `?parameter.balance.le=1234` or `?parameter.time.le=2021-02-01`.

as.description:
**Same as** filter mode. \
Specify a string template to get items where the specified field matches the specified template. \
This mode supports wildcard `*`. Use `\*` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?parameter.as=*mid*` or `?parameter.as=*end`.

un.description:
**Unlike** filter mode. \
Specify a string template to get items where the specified field doesn't match the specified template.
This mode supports wildcard `*`. Use `\*` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?parameter.un=*mid*` or `?parameter.un=*end`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of strings or JSON array to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values. \

Example: `?parameter.amount.in=1,2,3` or `?parameter.in=[{"from":"tz1","to":"tz2"},{"from":"tz2","to":"tz1"}]`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of strings to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values. \
Use `\,` as an escape symbol.

Example: `?parameter.amount.ni=1,2,3` or `?parameter.ni=[{"from":"tz1","to":"tz2"},{"from":"tz2","to":"tz1"}]`.

null.description:
**Is null** filter mode. \
Use this mode to get items where the specified field is null or not.

Example: `?parameter.null` or `?parameter.null=false` or `?parameter.sigs.[0].null=false`.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=applied` is the same as `param=applied`). \
Specify an operation status to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type=failed`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify an operation status to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type.ne=applied`.

level.description: Height of the block at which the account balance was calculated

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the block at which the account balance was calculated

quote.description: Injected historical quote at the time of balance snapshot

contract.description: Smart contract in which's storage the bigmap is allocated

path.description: Path to the bigmap in the contract storage

tags.description: List of tags ( `metadata`, `token_metadata`,`ledger`, or `null` if there are no tags)

firstLevel.description: Level of the block where the bigmap was seen first time

lastLevel.description: Level of the block where the bigmap was seen last time

totalKeys.description: Total number of keys ever added to the bigmap

activeKeys.description: Total number of currently active keys

updates.description: Total number of actions with the bigmap

keyType.description: Bigmap key type as JSON schema or Micheline, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.

valueType.description: Bigmap value type as JSON schema or Micheline, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify a comma-separated list of bigmap tags to get bigmaps with exactly the same set of tags.
Avoid using this mode and use `.any` or `.all` instead, because it may not work as expected due to internal 'hidden' tags.

Example: `?tags=metadata` or `?tags=token_metadata,metadata`.

any.description:
**Has any** filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of bigmap tags to get bigmaps where at least one of the specified tags is presented.

Example: `?tags.any=metadata` or `?tags.any=token_metadata,metadata`.

all.description:
**Has all** filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of bigmap tags to get bigmaps where all of the specified tags are presented.

Example: `?tags.all=metadata` or `?tags.all=token_metadata,metadata`.

id.description: Internal Id, can be used for pagination

key.description: Key in JSON or Micheline format, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.

value.description:
Value in JSON or Micheline format, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.
Note, if the key is inactive (removed) it will contain the last non-null value.

firstLevel.description: Level of the block where the bigmap key was seen first time

lastLevel.description: Level of the block where the bigmap key was seen last time

updates.description: Total number of actions with the bigmap key

id.description: Internal Id, can be used for pagination

level.description: Level of the block where the bigmap key was updated

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the block where the bigmap key was updated

value.description:
Value in JSON or Micheline format, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.
Note, if the action is `remove_key` it will contain the last non-null value.

id.description: Internal Id, can be used for pagination

key.description: Key in JSON or Micheline format, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.

value.description:
Value in JSON or Micheline format, depending on the `micheline` query parameter.
Note, if the key is inactive (removed) it will contain the last non-null value.

level.description: Height of the block from the genesis

timestamp.description: Datetime at which the block is claimed to have been created (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

proto.description: Protocol code, representing a number of protocol changes since genesis (mod 256, but `-1` for the genesis block)

payloadRound.description: Round at which the block payload was proposed

blockRound.description: Round at which the block was produced

validations.description: Number of endorsements (slots), included into the block

deposit.description: Security deposit frozen on the baker's account for producing the block (micro tez)

reward.description: Fixed reward paid to the payload proposer (micro tez)

bonus.description: Bonus reward paid to the block producer (micro tez)

fees.description: Total fee gathered from operations, included into the block

nonceRevealed.description:
Status of the seed nonce revelation
`true` - seed nonce revealed
`false` - there's no `seed_nonce_hash` in the block or seed nonce revelation has missed

proposer.description: Baker who proposed the block payload

lbEscapeVote.description: Flag indicating that the baker has voted for disabling liquidity baking

lbEscapeEma.description: Liquidity baking escape EMA value with precision of 1000 for integer computation

endorsements.description:
List of endorsement (is operation, which specifies the head of the chain as seen by the endorser of a given slot)
operations, included in the block

preendorsements.description: List of preendorsement operations, included in the block

proposals.description:
List of proposal (is used by bakers (delegates) to submit and/or upvote proposals to amend the protocol)
operations, included in the block

ballots.description: List of ballot (is used to vote for a proposal in a given voting cycle) operations, included in the block

activations.description:
List of activation (is used to activate accounts that were recommended allocations of
tezos tokens for donations to the Tezos Foundation’s fundraiser) operations, included in the block

doubleBaking.description:
List of double baking evidence (is used by bakers to provide evidence of double baking (baking two different
blocks at the same height) by a baker) operations, included in the block

doubleEndorsing.description:
List of double endorsement evidence (is used by bakers to provide evidence of double endorsement
(endorsing two different blocks at the same block height) by a baker) operations, included in the block

doublePreendorsing.description: List of double preendorsement evidence operations, included in the block

nonceRevelations.description: List of nonce revelation (are used by the blockchain to create randomness) operations, included in the block

delegations.description:
List of delegation (is used to delegate funds to a delegate (an implicit account registered as a baker))
operations, included in the block

originations.description: List of origination (deployment / contract creation ) operations, included in the block

transactions.description:
List of transaction (is a standard operation used to transfer tezos tokens to an account)
operations, included in the block

reveals.description: List of reveal (is used to reveal the public key associated with an account) operations, included in the block

registerConstants.description: List of register global constant operations, included in the block

setDepositsLimits.description: List of set deposits limit operations, included in the block

migrations.description: List of migration operations, implicitly applied at the end of the block

revelationPenalties.description: List of revelation penalty operations, implicitly applied at the end of the block

endorsingRewards.description: List of endorsing rewards, implicitly applied at the end of the block

quote.description: Injected historical quote at the time of block

activated.description: Flag showing whether the account has been activated or not.

activationLevel.description: Level of the block at which the account has been activated. `null` if the account is not activated yet.

activationTime.description: Datetime of the block at which the account has been activated (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`). `null` if the account is not activated yet.

activatedAccount.description: Info about activated account. `null` if the account is not activated yet.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance=1234`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance.ne=1234`.

gt.description:
**Greater than** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is greater than the specified value.

Example: `?balance.gt=1234`.

ge.description:
**Greater or equal** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is greater than equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance.ge=1234`.

lt.description:
**Less than** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is less than the specified value.

Example: `?balance.lt=1234`.

le.description:
**Less or equal** filter mode. \
Specify an integer number to get items where the specified field is less than or equal to the specified value.

Example: `?balance.le=1234`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of integers to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values.

Example: `?level.in=12,14,52,69`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of integers to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?level.ni=12,14,52,69`.

null.description:
**Is null** filter mode. \
Use this mode to get items where the specified field is null or not.

Example: `?nonce.null` or `?nonce.null=false`.

value.description: Constant value (either micheline, michelson or bytes, depending on the `format` parameter)

refs.description: Number of contracts referencing this constant

creationLevel.description: Level of the first block baked with this software

creationTime.description: Datetime of the first block baked with this software

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify an expression hash to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?address=expr...`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify an expression hash to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?address.ne=expr...`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of expression hashes to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values.

Example: `?address.in=expr1,expr2`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of expression hashes to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?address.ni=expr1,expr2`.

storageSchema.description: JSON Schema of the contract storage in humanified format (as returned by API)

parameterSchema.description: JSON Schema of the entrypoint parameter in humanified format (as returned by API)

path.description: Full path to the Big_map in the contract storage

keySchema.description: JSON Schema of the Big_map key in humanified format (as returned by API)

valueSchema.description: JSON Schema of the Big_map value in humanified format (as returned by API)

jsonParameters.description: A kind of JSON schema, describing how parameters will look like in a human-readable JSON format

unused.description:
Unused means that the entrypoint can be normalized to a more specific one.
For example here `(or %entry1 (unit %entry2) (nat %entry3))` the `%entry1` is unused entrypoint
because it can be normalized to `%entry2` or `%entry3`

jsonParameterType.description: Parameter type in human-readable JSON format

jsonReturnType.description: Return type in human-readable JSON format

id.description: Id of the record that can be used for pagination

level.description: Level at which the storage value was taken

timestamp.description: Timestamp at which the storage value was taken

operation.description: Operation that caused the storage change

type.description: Operation type

counter.description: Operation counter (null in case of synthetic operations)

nonce.description: Operation nonce (null in case of non-internal or synthetic operations)

parameter.description: Transaction parameter, including called entrypoint and value passed to the entrypoint.

firstLevel.description: Level of the first block in the cycle

startTime.description: Timestamp of the first block in the cycle

lastLevel.description: Level of the last block in the cycle

endTime.description: Timestamp of the last block in the cycle

snapshotLevel.description: Height of the block where the snapshot was taken

randomSeed.description: Randomly generated seed used by the network for things like baking rights distribution etc.

totalBakers.description: Total number of all active in this cycle bakers

totalStaking.description: Total staking balance of all active in this cycle bakers

totalDelegators.description: Total number of active bakers' delegators

totalDelegated.description: Total balance delegated to active bakers

selectedBakers.description: Total number of bakers in stake distribution for the cycle

selectedStake.description: Total stake of bakers in stake distribution for the cycle

quote.description: Injected historical quote at the end of the cycle

chain.description: Alias name of the chain (or "private" if it's not on the list of known chains)

level.description: The height of the last block from the genesis block

timestamp.description: The datetime at which the last block is claimed to have been created (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

votingEpoch.description: Current voring epoch index, starting from zero

votingPeriod.description: Current voting period index, starting from zero

knownLevel.description: The height of the last known block from the genesis block

lastSync.description: The datetime of last TzKT indexer synchronization (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

quoteLevel.description: The height of the block where quotes were updated last time

eq.description:

Specify a protocol hash to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?protocol=PsCARTHAGaz...`.

ne.description:

Specify a protocol hash to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

in.description:

Example: `?sender.in=PsCARTHAGaz,PsBabyM1eUX`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \

eq.description:

Example: `?type.ne=proposal_invoice`.

in.description:

code.description: Protocol code, representing a number of protocol changes since genesis (mod 256, but `-1` for the genesis block)

firstLevel.description: Block height where the protocol was applied

firstCycle.description: Index of the first cycle started with the protocol

firstCycleLevel.description: Level of the first block of the first cycle started with the protocol

lastLevel.description: Block height where the protocol ends. `null` if the protocol is active

rampUpCycles.description: The number of cycles where security deposit is ramping up

noRewardCycles.description: The number of cycles with no baking rewards

preservedCycles.description: A number of cycles in which baker's security deposit and rewards are frozen

blocksPerCycle.description: A number of blocks the cycle contains

blocksPerCommitment.description: A number of blocks that indicates how often seed nonce hash is included in a block. Seed nonce hash presents in only one out of `blocksPerCommitment`

blocksPerSnapshot.description: A number of blocks that indicates how often a snapshot (snapshots are records of the state of rolls distributions) is taken

blocksPerVoting.description: A number of block that indicates how long a voting period takes

timeBetweenBlocks.description: Minimum amount of seconds between blocks

endorsersPerBlock.description: Number of bakers that assigned to endorse a block

hardOperationGasLimit.description: Maximum amount of gas that one operation can consume

hardOperationStorageLimit.description: Maximum amount of storage that one operation can consume

hardBlockGasLimit.description: Maximum amount of total gas usage of a single block

tokensPerRoll.description: Required number of tokens to get 1 roll (micro tez)

revelationReward.description: Reward for seed nonce revelation (micro tez)

blockDeposit.description: Security deposit for baking (producing) a block (micro tez)

blockReward.description: Reward for baking (producing) a block (micro tez)

endorsementDeposit.description: Security deposit for sending an endorsement operation (micro tez)

endorsementReward.description: Reward for sending an endorsement operation (micro tez)

originationSize.description: Initial storage size of an originated (created) account (bytes)

byteCost.description: Cost of one storage byte in the blockchain (micro tez)

proposalQuorum.description: Percentage of the total number of rolls required to select a proposal on the proposal period

ballotQuorumMin.description: The minimum value of quorum percentage on the exploration and promotion periods

ballotQuorumMax.description: The maximum value of quorum percentage on the exploration and promotion periods

lbSubsidy.description: Liquidity baking subsidy is 1/16th of total rewards for a block of priority 0 with all endorsements

lbSunsetLevel.description: Level after protocol activation when liquidity baking shuts off

lbEscapeThreshold.description: 1/2 window size of 2000 blocks with precision of 1000 for integer computation

minParticipationNumerator.description: Number of endorsed slots needed to receive endorsing rewards

minParticipationDenominator.description: Number of endorsed slots needed to receive endorsing rewards

maxSlashingPeriod.description: Number of cycles after double baking/(pre)endorsing where an accusation operation can be injected

frozenDepositsPercentage.description: How much of baker's active stake is frozen as a security deposit

doubleBakingPunishment.description: How much mutez is burned from baker's frozen deposits, in case of double baking

doubleEndorsingPunishmentNumerator.description: How much is burned from baker's frozen deposits, in case of double (pre)endorsing

doubleEndorsingPunishmentDenominator.description: How much is burned from baker's frozen deposits, in case of double (pre)endorsing

docs.description: Link to the documentation with explanation of the protocol and changes

level.description: The level of the block at which the quote has been saved

timestamp.description: The datetime at which the quote has been saved (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

cycle.description: Cycle in which rewards were or will be earned.

stakingBalance.description: Staking balance at the snapshot time.

activeStake.description: Active stake participating in rights distribution.

selectedStake.description: Total active stake among all selected bakers.

delegatedBalance.description: Balance delegated to the baker at the snapshot time (sum of delegators' balances).

numDelegators.description: Number of delegators at the snapshot time.

expectedBlocks.description: Expected value of how many blocks baker should produce based on baker's active stake, selected stake and blocks per cycle.

expectedEndorsements.description: Expected value of how many slots baker should validate based on baker's active stake, selected stake and endorsing slots per cycle.

missedBlockFees.description: Operation fees which were not received due to missing blocks.

delegators.description: List of delegators at the snapshot time

balance.description: Balance of the delegator at the snapshot time

currentBalance.description: Balance of the delegator at the moment

emptied.description:
Indicates whether the delegator is emptied (at the moment, not at the snapshot time).
Emptied accounts (users with zero balance) should be re-allocated, so if you make payment to emptied account you will pay (burn) `0.257 tez` allocation fee.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify baking right type to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type=baking`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify baking right type to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type.ne=endorsing`.

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify baking right status to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type=future`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify baking right status to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?type.ne=missed`.

cycle.description: Cycle on which the right can be realized.

level.description: Level at which a block must be baked or an endorsement must be sent.

timestamp.description: Time (estimated, in case of future rights) when a block must be baked or an endorsement must be sent.

round.description:
Round (0 - ∞) at which the baker can propose/produce a block.
If a baker at round  `0` doesn't produce a block within the given time interval, then the right goes to a baker at round` 1`, etc.
For `endorsing` rights this field is always `null`.

slots.description: Number of slots (1 - 32) to be endorsed. For `baking` rights this field is always `null`.

baker.description: Baker to which baking or endorsing right has been given.

firstLevel.description: Level of the first block baked with this software

firstTime.description: Datetime of the first block baked with this software

lastLevel.description: Level of the last block baked with this software

lastTime.description: Datetime of the last block baked with this software

blocksCount.description: Total number of blocks baked with this software

cycle.description: Cycle at the end of which the statistics has been calculated. This field is only present in cyclic statistics.

date.description: Day at the end of which the statistics has been calculated. This field is only present in daily statistics.

level.description: Level of the block at which the statistics has been calculated

timestamp.description: Timestamp of the block at which the statistics has been calculated (ISO 8601, e.g. `2020-02-20T02:40:57Z`)

totalSupply.description: Total supply - all existing tokens (including locked vested funds and frozen funds) plus not yet activated fundraiser tokens

circulatingSupply.description: Circulating supply - all active tokens which can affect supply and demand (can be spent/transferred)

totalBootstrapped.description: Total amount of tokens initially created when starting the blockchain

totalCommitments.description: Total commitment amount (tokens to be activated by fundraisers)

totalActivated.description: Total amount of tokens activated by fundraisers

totalBanished.description: Total amount of tokens sent to the null-address, which is equivalent to burning

totalFrozen.description: Total amount of frozen tokens (frozen security deposits, frozen rewards and frozen fees)

quote.description: Injected historical quote at the time of the block at which the statistics has been calculated

fields.description:
**Fields** selection mode (optional, i.e. `select.fields=balance` is the same as `select=balance`). \
Specify a comma-separated list of fields to include into response.

Example:
`?select=address,balance as b,metadata.name as meta_name` will result in
`[ { "address": "asd", "b": 10, "meta_name": "qwe" } ]`.

values.description:
**Values** selection mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of fields to include their values into response.

Example:
`?select.values=address,balance,metadata.name`  will result in
`[ [ "asd", 10, "qwe" ] ]`.

hash.description: Hash of the proposal, which representing a tarball of concatenated .ml/.mli source files

initiator.description: Information about the baker (delegate) submitted the proposal

firstPeriod.description: The first voting period where the proposal was active

lastPeriod.description: The last voting period where the proposal was active

epoch.description: The voting epoch where the proposal was active

upvotes.description: The total number of upvotes (proposal operations)

rolls.description: The total number of rolls, upvoted the proposal

status.description:
Status of the proposal
`active` - the proposal in the active state
`accepted` - the proposal was accepted
`rejected` - the proposal was rejected due to too many "nay" ballots
`skipped` - the proposal was skipped due to the quorum was not reached

hash.description: Hash of the proposal, which representing a tarball of concatenated .ml/.mli source files

agora.description: Link to the proposal on Tezos Agora portall with full details

invoice.description: Reward for the proposal developers, that will be generated if the proposal is accepted

index.description: Index of the voting period, starting from zero

epoch.description: Index of the voting epoch, starting from zero

firstLevel.description: The height of the block in which the period starts

startTime.description: The timestamp of the block in which the period starts

lastLevel.description: The height of the block in which the period ends

endTime.description: The timestamp of the block in which the period ends

kind.description:
Kind of the voting period:
`proposal` - delegates can submit protocol amendment proposals using the proposal operation
`exploration` -  bakers (delegates) may vote on the top-ranked proposal from the previous Proposal Period using the ballot operation
`testing` - If the proposal is approved in the Exploration Period, the testing (or 'cooldown') period begins and bakers start testing the new protocol
`promotion` - delegates can cast one vote to promote or not the tested proposal using the ballot operation
`adoption` - after the proposal is actually accepted, the ecosystem has some time to prepare to the upgrade
Learn more: https://tezos.gitlab.io/whitedoc/voting.html

status.description:
Status of the voting period:
`active` - means that the voting period is in progress
`no_proposals` - means that there were no proposals during the voting period
`no_quorum` - means that there was a voting but the quorum was not reached
`no_supermajority` - means that there was a voting but the supermajority was not reached
`success` - means that the period was finished with positive voting result

totalBakers.description: The number of bakers on the voters list

totalRolls.description: The number of rolls of bakers on the voters list

upvotesQuorum.description: Upvotes quorum percentage (only for proposal period)

proposalsCount.description: The number of proposals injected during the voting period (only for proposal period)

topUpvotes.description: This is how many upvotes (proposal operations) the most upvoted proposal has (only for proposal period)

topRolls.description: This is how many rolls the most upvoted proposal has (only for proposal period)

ballotsQuorum.description: Ballots quorum percentage (only for exploration and promotion periods)

supermajority.description: Supermajority percentage (only for exploration and promotion periods)

yayBallots.description: The number of the ballots with "yay" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

yayRolls.description: Total rolls of the ballots with "yay" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

nayBallots.description: The number of the ballots with "nay" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

nayRolls.description: Total rolls of the ballots with "nay" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

passBallots.description: The number of the ballots with "pass" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

passRolls.description: Total rolls of the ballots with "pass" vote (only for exploration and promotion periods)

status.description:
Voter's status:
`none` - the voter did nothing
`upvoted` - the voter upvoted at least one proposal
`voted_yay` - the voter voted "yay"
`voted_nay` - the voter voted "nay"
`voted_pass` - the voter voted "pass"

eq.description:
**Equal** filter mode (optional, i.e. `param.eq=123` is the same as `param=123`). \
Specify a voter status to get items where the specified field is equal to the specified value.

Example: `?status=none`.

ne.description:
**Not equal** filter mode. \
Specify a voter status to get items where the specified field is not equal to the specified value.

Example: `?status.ne=none`.

in.description:
**In list** (any of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of voter statuses to get items where the specified field is equal to one of the specified values.

Example: `?status.in=voted_yay,voted_nay`.

ni.description:
**Not in list** (none of) filter mode. \
Specify a comma-separated list of voter statuses to get items where the specified field is not equal to all the specified values.

Example: `?status.ni=none,upvoted`.

index.description: Index of the voting epoch, starting from zero

firstLevel.description: The height of the block in which the epoch starts

startTime.description: The timestamp of the block in which the epoch starts

lastLevel.description: The height of the block in which the epoch ends

endTime.description: The timestamp of the block in which the epoch ends

status.description:
Status of the voting epoch:
`no_proposals` - there were no proposals proposed
`voting` - there was at least one proposal and the voting is in progress
`completed` - voting successfully completed and the proposal was accepted
`failed` - voting was not completed due to either quorum or supermajority was not reached

proposals.description: Proposals pushed during the voting epoch (null, if there were no proposals).

tags.name: TzKT Events
tags.description:
TzKT Events is a WebSocket API based on [SignalR](https://docs.microsoft.com/aspnet/signalr/overview/getting-started/introduction-to-signalr)
that enables receiving data from the Tezos blockchain in real-time.

This is a very useful feature, especially when you need to receive updates immediately, as soon as they appear on the node and are indexed by the indexer.
Also it allows to significantly simplify client's logic responsible for updating/synchronizing data.

Events base URL: `https://{baseUrl}/v1/events`

## Message types

After connecting to the WebSocket and subscribing to some events the client starts receiving messages from the server.
There are three message types that the server sends to the client:

#### 1. State message

````js
{
	type: 0,    // 0 - state message
	state: 0    // subscription state
}
````

This is the very first message the client receives from the server after opening a subscription. 
This message is a kind of confirmation that the subscription has been successfully processed.

There is just one meaningful field - `state`, that represents current state of the subscription.
The type of that field depends on a particular subscription (see documentation on each subscription).
For example, if you subscribe to new blocks, the `state` will contain a level of the last sent block.
So if you receive a state message with `state: 1300123`, the next block you may expect to receive will be `1300124`.

State can be used to fetch historical data from the REST API right after opening a subscription, so that there will be no nor misses nor duplicates.

#### 2. Data message	  

````js
{
	type: 1,    // 1 - data message
	state: 0,   // subscription state
	data: {}    // data: object or array, depending on subscription
}
````

After subscription is registered and state message is received, client will receive data messages. As you can see, `data` is an array (array of
blocks, operations, or whatever you have subscribed to), that means you may receive multiple items in a single message,
which is great for performance and network traffic.

TzKT Events operates with the same data models as the REST API to achieve full compatibility and data consistency.

#### 3. Reorg message	

````js
{			  
	type: 2,    // 2 - reorg message
	state: 0    // subscription state
}
````

Reorg messages signal about chain reorganizations, when some blocks, including all operations, are rolled back
in favor of blocks with higher weight.  Chain reorgs happen quite often, so it's not something you can ignore.
You have to handle such messages correctly, otherwise you will likely accumulate duplicate data or, worse, invalid data.

For example, if you receive blocks `10`, `11`, `12`, `13` and then receive reorg message with `state: 11`,
you should remove blocks `12` and `13` (if you saved them) as they are no longer valid.
